title: Airbnb's JavaScript Style Guide and ESLint
summary: Airbnb's open-source JavaScript Style Guide became the industry standard for ES6+ code style, adopted by millions of developers and projects worldwide.
background: As Airbnb's engineering team grew, inconsistent code style created friction in code reviews and made onboarding new engineers harder. Manual style enforcement was unscalable.
response: Airbnb formalised their JavaScript conventions in a detailed style guide and released a custom ESLint configuration (eslint-config-airbnb) to enforce rules automatically.
outcome: The Airbnb ESLint config became the most popular npm package of its type, with tens of millions of weekly downloads. The style guide has shaped how a generation of developers writes JavaScript.
lessons: Automated enforcement scales where manual review cannot
Open-sourcing internal tools creates community goodwill
Shared conventions reduce cognitive load in code review
Opinionated defaults enable focus on business logic
discussion_questions: What are the trade-offs of adopting an opinionated style guide?
How should teams decide when to deviate from a community standard?
